result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, DNA sample-costs and surcharge by 10-13-16. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
Court STAYED sentence for 9 months pending a review on 10-13-16 at 8:15am

BY THE REVIEW DATE THE DEFENDANT IS TO:
- Defendant to follow all rules determined by Children's Court.
- Defendant to continue with individual counseling and provide the court with proof of completion or continuation of counseling at the review date.
- Defendant to provide a letter from GAL.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment as able.
- Perform 20 hours of community service at a non- profit charitable organization.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Harris

records.addlTxt: No response to letter filed June 1, 2020 because defendant did not provide contact information.
Received and filed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for review hearing. Defense counsel request expungment. Court DENIED defense request. 
State advised the court that the defendant has complied will all requirements of the sentence. Court find the defendant has complied with all terms and conditions of sentence. Case completed.
Defendant appeared in Branch 21 for Review Hearing. Case was not calendared for Branch 21. Clerk gave the defendant new date for review.
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 


The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, credit for 3 days time served.  

The court will STAY the sentence for 9 months pending a review on 10/13/2016 at 8:15 a.m. 

By the review date the defendant is to:
-Defendant to follow all rules determined by Children's Court.
-Defendant to continue with individual counseling and provide the court with proof of completion or continuation of counseling at the review date.
-Defendant to provide a letter from GAL.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment as able.
-Perform 20 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, DNA sample-costs and surcharge by 10/13/2016.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.


RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit..

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge be amended to a Battery pursuant to Wisc. Stats 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.   Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.   Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Motion for modification of the no contact order heard.  Court modifies the no contact order as outlined in the Children's Court Order.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting that the FPT be changed to a plea date on 12-22-2015.

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned in branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is not prepared to proceed to plea hearing on today's date.  Defense counsel requests brief adjournment.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 38.

October 26 trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Nicole Harris in court.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for calendar call.  Defendant is appearing. Per prior conversations with defense counsel, a plea and sentencing date was selected. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
State and victim/witness advised of date change via email.

Defense counsel is requesting a new date for plea/sentencing as she is out of county on 9-11-2015.  New date of 10-7-2015 at 8:15 is set and agreed to by state and defense.
Defendant MUST appear on 9-11-2015 to receive the new date from the court.  Defense counsel will advise defendant to appear.
Stipulation for Substitution of Counsel received.  New counsel of record is Wendy Patrickus.

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.
Offer received by defense counsel.  Defense Motion to Modify the No Contact Order was heard and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-26-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Hearing on Defense Motion to Modify the No Contact Order is heard.  The State will follow-up if there are any referrals for defendant, regarding the 6 year old child who previously lived in the home.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference / Bail-Bond Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
and Inspection from defense, received and filed.   mld
Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

05/16/2015
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMH dob 5/19/03 unless supervised by BMCW or contracted agency.

  Oral No Contact Order:  Defendant to have NO unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.

Defendant Nicole Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Nicole Harris in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
